article.headline: Centenary 77, McNeese State 71
article.story: SHREVEPORT, La. (AP) -- Michael Gale had 19 points and five rebounds as Centenary defeated McNeese State 77-71 on Saturday. Centenary (3-2) was behind 64-59 with seven minutes left in the game, but an 8-0 run over the next three minutes gave the Gents a three-point lead. Gale hit four free throws and Andrew Wisniewski made two free throws to spark the final rally. Gale was 6-of-10 shooting from the field and 7-of-10 from the free throw line. Wisniewski hit 12-of-13 free throw attempts and scored 18 points. He also had five rebounds, four assists and three steals. Chad Maclies earned his first double-double with 10 points and 13 rebounds. Edward Garriet was 3-of-3 from the 3-point line for McNeese and hit 6-of-12 shots from behind the arc. He scored 24 points. The Cowboys (3-3) were in foul trouble throughout the game with every player having at least three fouls at the end of the game. That led to 37 free throw attempts by the Gents. Centenary outrebounded McNeese 33-25 and had seven blocked shots to the Cowboys' five. The Gents made all 16 of their free throws in the second half as they outscored the Cowboys 38-30 in that half.
